block.railways.narrow_double_scotch_boge: Narrow Gauge Double Scotch Yoke Bogey
railways.ponder.conductor_constructing.t: Conductors are constructed with an andesite casing.
railways.ponder.conductor_redstoning.tex: Conductors can press buttons when a player looks at them.
Conductors also toggle levers when a player looks at them.
Conductors do not activate redstone if a player is wearing a different-colored cap from them.
railways.ponder.conductor_toolboxing.tex: Toolboxes function normally when equipped on Conductors.
railways.ponder.door_modes.text_1: Doors have multiple modes of operation: Normal, Manual, and Special
railways.ponder.door_modes.text_2: In normal mode (the default) and manual mode, manual operation of the door is possible
railways.ponder.door_modes.text_3: and redstone operation works in normal mode and special mode
railways.ponder.door_modes.text_4: Doors in normal and special modes open and close when a contraption moves or stops
railways.ponder.door_modes.text_5: Doors in manual mode only change when a player interacts with them
railways.ponder.door_modes.text_6: Doors in special mode cannot be toggled simply by using them
railways.ponder.door_modes.text_7: Sneaking, however, allows the player to toggle the door anyway
railways.ponder.train_coupler.text_1: Select a Train Track then place the Coupler nearby
railways.ponder.train_coupler.text_2: The Train Coupler lets you couple and decouple trains without disassembling them
railways.ponder.train_coupler.text_3: By scrolling with a wrench you can change the gap between the couple/decouple pads
railways.ponder.train_coupler.text_4: By using a wrench you can cycle between coupling, decoupling, and both modes
railways.ponder.train_coupler.text_5: Stations can be used to help align trains for coupling
railways.ponder.train_coupler.text_6: By powering a coupler you can couple/decouple a properly aligned train
railways.ponder.train_semaphore.text_1: Semaphores are placed on poles above Train Signals
railways.ponder.train_semaphore.text_2: Semaphore poles can be made of different materials
railways.ponder.train_semaphore.text_3: Semaphores show the current state of the signal below the pole
railways.ponder.train_semaphore.text_4: If a brass signal has multiple valid exit paths...
railways.ponder.train_semaphore.text_5: ... a second semaphore can be placed above the first
railways.ponder.train_semaphore.text_6: The bottom semaphore will now close if any of the available paths are blocked
railways.ponder.train_semaphore.text_7: The top semaphore will close if all paths are blocked
railways.ponder.train_semaphore.text_8: When 2 semaphores are placed on a non-brass signal, they both close simultaneously
railways.ponder.train_switch.text_1: Select a Train Track then place the Switch nearby
railways.ponder.train_switch.text_2: The Switch will direct any Trains passing over the marker
railways.ponder.train_switch.text_3: Cycle the switch to the right by using it
railways.ponder.train_switch.text_4: Cycle the switch to the left by using it while sneaking
railways.ponder.train_switch.text_5: Switches provide a comparator signal based on the direction: 1 for left, 0 for straight, and 2 for right
railways.ponder.train_switch.text_6: Switch direction can also be set by a redstone signal, and can be locked by powering the bottom
railways.ponder.train_switch.text_7: Projectiles also cycle switches on impact
railways.tooltip.coupler.error.mode_not_: Action not permitted in current mode
railways.tooltip.coupler.error.missing_t: Requires both track points to be occupied
railways.tooltip.coupler.error.carriage_: Carriage(s) not aligned properly. Hint: The center of the bogey should be aligned over the coupler track point.
Carriages must be facing the same direction. Hint: Use a wrench to reorient the carriages.
railways.station.train_limit.tooltip.1: Reserve station before approaching train has arrived
railways.station.train_limit.tooltip.2: to more evenly space trains in a multi-platform station
railways.whistle.tool.bound_usage: Use on a track to summon the bound train!
railways.whistle.tool.not_bound: Not bound, use on a conductor riding a train to bind.
railways.whistle.not_owner: You must be the owner of the train to bind the whistle.
railways.whistle.failure.conductor_missi: Conductor not found or it was not riding the bound train.
railways.whistle.failure.not_owner: You must be the owner of the train to cancel its schedule.
railways.remote_lens.tool.bound_usage: Use to spy through the eyes of the bound conductor!
railways.remote_lens.tool.not_bound: Not bound, use on a conductor wearing goggles to bind.
header.railways.optifine: Warning: Optifine present on game client
message.railways.optifine: Warning: Steam 'n' Rails is incompatible with Optifine, ranging from minor visual artifacts to game crashes. It's recommended to remove the mod to avoid these issues and more. This warning can be disabled in Steam 'n' Rails client sided configs however you accept responsibility for any bugs or issues you encounter. If you needed Optifine for one reason or another, check PrismLauncher's Optifine Alternatives list:
block.create.track_station.tooltip.summa: A _deployer_ holding a _wrench_ can automatically assemble and disassemble trains by hitting a _station_. _Hint_: hoppers can be used to put a wrench in a deployer.
block.railways.track_phantom.summary: _Phantom Tracks_ are compatible with _all_ bogey types
block.railways.track_phantom.tooltip.con: When you hold a Phantom Track in your hand
block.railways.track_phantom.tooltip.beh: _Phantom Tracks_ in the world will be _visible_
block.railways.track_phantom.tooltip.con: When you don't hold a Phantom Track in your hand
block.railways.track_phantom.tooltip.beh: _Phantom Tracks_ in the world will be _invisible_
block.create.railway_casing.tooltip.summ: Press and hold the _Focus Schematic Overlay_ key (default _ALT_) to select the _bogey style_ to place.
_: Thank you for translating Steam 'n' Rails!
